columns.name: event_page_wiki
columns.comment: The Wiki ID the page is stored.

columns.name: event_page_prefixedtext
columns.comment: The full prefixedtext of the event page. This is needed for the crosswikiness, see T307358.

columns.name: event_chat_url
columns.comment: The link of the chat tool the organizers use to communicate.

columns.name: event_status
columns.comment: Status of the event. 1: Open. 2: Closed. 3: Draft. 4: Canceled.

columns.name: event_timezone
columns.comment: Timezone of the event, used with event_start_local and event_end_local.

columns.name: event_start_local
columns.comment: Start time of the event, in the local timezone (stored in event_timezone), in the TS_MW format. This does not use mwtimestamp because that is only intended for UTC time.

columns.name: event_start_utc
columns.comment: Start time of the event, in UTC. This value is derived from event_start_local, and is used for sorting.

columns.name: event_end_local
columns.comment: End time of the event, in the local timezone (stored in event_timezone), in the TS_MW format. This does not use mwtimestamp because that is only intended for UTC time.

columns.name: event_end_utc
columns.comment: End time of the event, in UTC. This value is derived from event_end_local, and is used for sorting.

columns.name: event_track_contributions
columns.comment: Whether contribution tracking is enabled for this event.

columns.name: event_meeting_type
columns.comment: Participation options for the event. This was previously called "meeting type", which explains the column name. Possible values: 1 = in person, 2 = online, 3 = both.

indexes.name: event_page
indexes.comment: Used when querying events by pages. The index is currently unique, but this may change in the future.

indexes.name: event_timezone_id
indexes.comment: Used when updating UTC timestamps, filtering by timezone and batching by primary key.

name: ce_participants
comment: Stores the participants of an event.

columns.name: cep_event_id
columns.comment: Gets the event id from campaign_events table.

columns.name: cep_user_id
columns.comment: The Central ID.

columns.name: cep_private
columns.comment: Whether the user registered privately for the event.

columns.name: cep_first_answer_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the participant answered a question for the first time.

columns.name: cep_aggregation_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when this participant's answers were aggregated.

indexes.name: cep_event_participant
indexes.comment: Uniqueness constraint, used in queries where we need the event first.

indexes.name: cep_event_unregistered
indexes.comment: For COUNT measurements.

indexes.name: cep_user_unregistered_event
indexes.comment: For JOINs.

name: ce_organizers
comment: Stores the organizers of an event.

columns.name: ceo_event_id
columns.comment: Gets the event id from campaign_events table.

columns.name: ceo_user_id
columns.comment: The Central ID.

columns.name: ceo_roles
columns.comment: Bit set of the roles that the organizer has for a specific event.

columns.name: ceo_created_at
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the user first became an organizer.

columns.name: ceo_deleted_at
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the user stopped being an organizer.

columns.name: ceo_agreement_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the organizer agreed to the PII agreement.

indexes.name: ceo_event_user
indexes.comment: Uniqueness constraint, used when retrieving the organizers of an event.

indexes.name: ceo_user_event
indexes.comment: Used for JOINs.

columns.name: cea_full_address
columns.comment: Full address of the event.

columns.name: cea_country_code
columns.comment: Country code (CLDR) for the event.

indexes.name: cea_country_code
indexes.comment: Used when querying event country code.

name: ce_event_address
comment: Stores the id of the event and the id of an address.

columns.name: ceea_event
columns.comment: The id of the event on campaign_events.

columns.name: ceea_address
columns.comment: The id of the address on ce_address.

indexes.name: ceea_event_address
indexes.comment: Used when querying event address.

name: ce_tracking_tools
comment: Stores the tracking tools associated with an event.

columns.name: cett_event
columns.comment: The ID of the event, references campaign_events.event_id.

columns.name: cett_tool_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of this tracking tool, as defined by the application.

columns.name: cett_tool_event_id
columns.comment: The unique identifier of the event within the tracking tool.

columns.name: cett_sync_status
columns.comment: Status of the synchronization with the tool. The meaning of each value is defined in the application

columns.name: cett_last_sync
columns.comment: Timestamp of the last successful synchronization with this tool, or null if it was never synced.

name: ce_event_questions
comment: Stores what participant questions are enabled for an event.

columns.name: ceeq_event_id
columns.comment: The ID of the event, references campaign_events.event_id.

columns.name: ceeq_question_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of a question, as defined by the application.

name: ce_question_answers
comment: Stores the participants' answers to the questions asked when registering for an event.

columns.name: ceqa_event_id
columns.comment: The ID of the event, references campaign_events.event_id.

columns.name: ceqa_user_id
columns.comment: Central user ID.

columns.name: ceqa_question_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of a question, as defined by the application.

columns.name: ceqa_answer_option
columns.comment: The ID of a possible answer to this question, as defined by the application, if multiple choice. Null otherwise.

columns.name: ceqa_answer_text
columns.comment: Free-text answer to this question, if available, null otherwise.

name: ce_question_aggregation
comment: Stores the aggregated participants' answers to the questions asked when registering for an event.

columns.name: ceqag_event_id
columns.comment: The ID of the event, references campaign_events.event_id.

columns.name: ceqag_question_id
columns.comment: The unique ID of a question, as defined by the application.

columns.name: ceqag_answer_option
columns.comment: The ID of a possible answer to this question, as defined by the application, if multiple choice. Null otherwise.

columns.name: ceqag_answers_amount
columns.comment: The amount of times this question was answered this way.

columns.name: ceil_user_id
columns.comment: ID of the user who created the list

columns.name: ceil_wiki
columns.comment: Wiki where the invitation list was created

indexes.name: ce_invitation_lists_event_id
indexes.comment: Get the invitation list by event ID

indexes.name: ce_invitation_lists_wiki
indexes.comment: Get invitation list by wiki, it will be used only for analytics

indexes.name: ce_invitation_lists_user_wiki
indexes.comment: Get invitation list by user id and wiki

name: ce_worklist_articles
comment: Stores the articles related to invitation list.

columns.name: cewa_page_title
columns.comment: This will be used to handle deleted pages to show redlinks, not storing page namespace because we're only supporting mainspace pages for now

indexes.name: ce_worklist_articles_ceil_id
indexes.comment: Get the list of articles by invitation list ID

name: ce_invitation_list_users
comment: Stores the users related to invitation lists.

columns.name: ceilu_ceil_id
columns.comment: ID of the associated ce_invitation_lists table

indexes.name: ce_invitation_list_users_ceil_id
indexes.comment: Get the list of users by invitation list ID

indexes.name: ce_invitation_list_users_ceilu_user_id
indexes.comment: Get the invitation list IDs a given user is assigned to. For now, it will be used only for analytics, but this may also be used in the application later

name: ce_event_wikis
comment: Stores the wikis related to events.

columns.name: ceew_wiki
columns.comment: Wiki ID, or the special value `*all*` to indicate "all wikis".

indexes.name: ce_event_wikis_event_id_wiki
indexes.comment: Retrieve all wikis associated with a specific event and filter by wiki.

name: ce_event_topics
comment: Stores the topics related to events.

columns.name: ceet_topic
columns.comment: Topic ID

indexes.name: ce_event_topics_event_id_topic
indexes.comment: Retrieve all topics associated with a specific event and filter by topics.

columns.name: cec_event_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to campaign_events.event_id

columns.name: cec_user_id
columns.comment: User ID, will be a central ID if a central provider is available, like for the other tables.

columns.name: cec_user_name
columns.comment: Username, used for sorting. Nullable to support user suppression and deletion.

columns.name: cec_page_id
columns.comment: The ID of the target page. This is used in lookups for page moves and page/revision deletion.

columns.name: cec_page_prefixedtext
columns.comment: The full prefixedtext of the target page. We need to store the whole thing because namespace IDs cannot be resolved cross-wiki, see T226667.

columns.name: cec_revision_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to revision.rev_id

columns.name: cec_edit_flags
columns.comment: Bit field with additional flags for the edit. 1=page creation

columns.name: cec_bytes_delta
columns.comment: Byte difference between this and the previous revision. This uses an integer like revision.rev_len, but this is signed, so there is a remote chance that extremely large diffs won't fit.

columns.name: cec_links_delta
columns.comment: Difference in the number of internal links between the previous and this revision. Smallint gives us an upper bound of 32767, which is somewhat arbitrary.

columns.name: cec_deleted
columns.comment: Whether the edit has been deleted (page or revision deletion), see T403200 (pseudo-boolean).

indexes.name: cec_wiki_page_id
indexes.comment: Locate all records for a given page, used for UPDATE queries in case of page move and deletion.

indexes.name: cec_wiki_revision
indexes.comment: Uniqueness constraint, also used for user-facing validation.

indexes.name: cec_event_user
indexes.comment: Filter edits for a given event, with a JOIN on ce_participants.

indexes.name: cec_user_id_name
indexes.comment: Used to handle user renames and suppressions/deletions.
